summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth the story of those things, whereof we are fully persuaded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they have delivered them unto us, which from the beginning saw them themselves, and were ministers of the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It seemed good also to me (most noble Theophilus) as soon as I had searched out perfectly all things from the beginning, to write unto thee thereof from point to point,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That thou mightest acknowledge the certainty of those things whereof thou hast been instructed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the time of Herod King of Judea, there was a certain Priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abijah: and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both were just before God, and walked in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord, without reproof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had no child, because that Elizabeth was barren: and both were well stricken in age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he executed the Priest’s office before God, as his course came in order,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the custom of the Priest’s office, his lot was to burn incense, when he went into the Temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole multitude of the people were without in prayer, while the incense was burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then appeared unto him an Angel of the Lord, standing at the right side of the Altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Zacharias saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: for thy prayer is heard, and thy wife Elizabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness, and many shall rejoice at his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall neither drink wine, nor strong drink: and he shall be filled with the holy Ghost, even from his mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to their Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just men, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zacharias said unto the Angel, Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife is of a great age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Angel answered, and said unto him, I am Gabriel that stand in the presence of God, and am sent to speak unto thee, and to show thee these good tidings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not be able to speak, until the day that these things be done, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people waited for Zacharias, and marveled that he tarried so long in the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: then they perceived that he had seen a vision in the Temple: for he made signs unto them, and remained dumb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the days of his office were fulfilled, that he departed to his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after those days, his wife Elizabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me, in the days wherein he looked on me, to take from me my rebuke among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the sixth month, the Angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To a virgin affianced to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David, and the virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Angel went in unto her, and said, Hail thou that art freely beloved: the Lord is with thee: blessed art thou among women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she saw him, she was troubled at his saying, and thought what manner of salutation that should be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For lo thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bear a son, and shalt call his Name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the most High, and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he shall reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of his kingdom shall be none end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Mary unto the Angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Angel answered, and said unto her, The holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the most High shall overshadow thee: therefore also that Holy thing which shall be born of thee, shall be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And behold, thy cousin, Elizabeth, she hath also conceived a son in her old age: and this is her sixth month, which was called barren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For with God shall nothing be impossible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary said, Behold the servant of the Lord: be it unto me according to thy word. So the Angel departed from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary arose in those days, and went into the hill country with haste to a city of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as Elizabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe sprang in her belly, and Elizabeth was filled with the holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she cried with a loud voice, and said, Blessed art thou among women, because the fruit of thy womb is blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whence cometh this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe sprang in my belly for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is she that believed: for those things shall be performed, which were told her from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary said, My soul magnifieth the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my spirit rejoiceth in God my Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he hath looked on the poor degree of his servant: for behold, from henceforth shall all ages call me blessed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he that is mighty hath done for me great things, and holy is his Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mercy is from generation to generation on them that fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that showed strength with his arm: he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath put down the mighty from their seats, and exalted them of low degree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath filled the hungry with good things, and sent away the rich empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath upholden Israel his servant to be mindful of his mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (As he hath spoken to our fathers, to wit, to Abraham and his seed) forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary abode with her about three months: after, she returned to her own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elizabeth’s time was fulfilled, that she should be delivered, and she brought forth a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her neighbors and cousins heard tell how the Lord had showed his great mercy upon her, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the babe, and called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his mother answered, and said, Not so, but he shall be called John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is named with this name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he asked for writing tablets, and wrote, saying, His name is John, and they marveled all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue, and he spake and praised God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then fear came on all them that dwelt near unto them, and all these words were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all they that heard them, laid them up in their hearts, saying, What manner child shall this be! and the hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his father Zacharias was filled with the holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, because he hath visited and redeemed his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hath raised up the horn of salvation unto us, in the house of his servant David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he spake by the mouth of his holy Prophets, which were since the world began, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That he would send us deliverance from our enemies, and from the hands of all that hate us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That he might show mercy towards our fathers: and remember his holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the oath, which he sware to our father Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which was, that he would grant unto us, that we being delivered out of the hands of our enemies, should serve him without fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of our life, in holiness and righteousness before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou, babe, shalt be called the Prophet of the most High: for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to give knowledge of salvation unto his people, by the remission of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through the tender mercy of our God, whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To give light to them that sit in darkness, and in the shadow of death, and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the wilderness, till the day came that he should show himself unto Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, that there came a decree from Augustus Caesar, that all the world should be taxed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This first taxing was made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore went all to be taxed, every man to his own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee out of a city called Nazareth, into Judea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem (because he was of the house and lineage of David,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To be taxed with Mary that was given him to wife, which was with child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, that while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she brought forth her first begotten son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a cratch, because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were in the same country shepherds, abiding in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, the Angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone about them, and they were sore afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Angel said unto them, Be not afraid: for behold, I bring you glad tidings of great joy, that shall be to all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is, that unto you is born this day in the city of David, a Savior, which is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall be a sign to you, Ye shall find the babe swaddled, and laid in a cratch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway there was with the Angel a multitude of heavenly soldiers, praising God, and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Glory be to God in the high heavens, and peace in earth, and toward men good will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass when the Angels were gone away from them into heaven, that the shepherds said one to another, Let us go then unto Bethlehem, and see this thing that is come to pass, which the Lord hath showed unto us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph and the babe laid in the cratch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had seen it, they published abroad the thing that was told them of that child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that heard it, wondered at the things which were told them of the shepherds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary kept all those sayings, and pondered them in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the shepherds returned glorifying and praising God, for all that they had heard and seen, as it was spoken unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the eight days were accomplished, that they should circumcise the child, his name was then called Jesus, which was named of the Angel, before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the days of her purification, after the Law of Moses, were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (As it is written in the Law of the Lord, Every man child that first openeth the womb, shall be called holy to the Lord,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to give an oblation, as it is commanded in the Law of the Lord, a pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon: this man was just, and feared God, and waited for the consolation of Israel, and the holy Ghost was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was declared to him from God by the holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen that Anointed of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came by the motion of the spirit into the Temple, and when the parents brought in the babe Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took him in his arms, and praised God, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A light to be revealed to the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph and his mother marveled at those things, which were spoken touching him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is appointed for the fall and rising again of many in Israel, and for a sign which shall be spoken against,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Yea and a sword shall pierce through thy soul) that the thoughts of many hearts may be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a Prophetess, one Anna the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher, which was of a great age, after she had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she was widow about fourscore, and four years, and went not out of the Temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She then coming at the same instant upon them, confessed likewise the Lord, and spake of him to all that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had performed all things, according to the Law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee to their own city Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew, and waxed strong in Spirit, and was filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem, every year, at the feast of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was twelve years old, and they were come up to Jerusalem, after the custom of the feast,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And had finished the days thereof, as they returned, the child Jesus remained in Jerusalem, and Joseph knew not, nor his mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they supposing that he had been in the company, went a day’s journey, and sought him among their kinsfolk, and acquaintances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they found him not, they turned back to Jerusalem, and sought him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass three days after, that they found him in the Temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that heard him, were astonied at his understanding and answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they saw him, they were amazed, and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee with very heavy hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he unto them, How is it that ye sought me? knew ye not that I must go about my Father’s business?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they understood not the word that he spake to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject to them: and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom, and stature, and in favor with God and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being Tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip Tetrarch of Iturea, and of the country of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the Tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (When Annas and Caiaphas were the high Priests) the word of God came unto John, the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came into all the coasts about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it is written in the book of the sayings of Isaiah the Prophet, which saith, The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness is, Prepare ye the way of the Lord: make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low, and crooked things shall be made straight, and the rough ways shall be made smooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to the people that were come out to be baptized of him, O generations of vipers, who hath forewarned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy amendment of life, and begin not to say with yourselves, We have Abraham to our Father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now also is the axe laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit, shall be hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, and said unto them, He that hath two coats, let him part with him that hath none: and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came there Publicans also to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Require no more than that which is appointed unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, And what shall we do? And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither accuse any falsely, and be content with your wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the people waited, and all men mused in their hearts of John, if he were not that Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, and said to them all, Indeed I baptize you with water, but one stronger than I, cometh, whose shoe’s latchet I am not worthy to unloose: he will baptize you with the holy Ghost, and with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whose fan is in his hand, and he will make clean his floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner, but the chaff will he burn up with fire that never shall be quenched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus then exhorting with many other things, he preached unto the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod the Tetrarch was rebuked of him, for Herodias his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, as all the people were baptized, and that Jesus was baptized and did pray, that the heaven was opened:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the holy Ghost came down in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and there was a voice from heaven, saying, Thou art my beloved Son: in thee I am well pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age, being as men supposed the son of Joseph, which was the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Janna, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Mattathiah, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Maath, the son of Mattathiah, the son of Semei, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Joannas, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattathah, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus full of the holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by that Spirit into the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And was there forty days tempted of the devil, and in those days he did eat nothing, but when they were ended, he afterward was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the devil said unto him, If thou be the son of God, command this stone, that it be made bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered him, saying, It is written, That man shall not live by bread only, but by every word of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him up into an high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, in the twinkling of an eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the devil said unto him, All this power will I give thee, and the glory of those kingdoms: for that is delivered to me: and to whomsoever I will, I give it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou therefore wilt worship me, they shall be all thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered him, and said, Hence from me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him alone thou shalt serve.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the Temple, and said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written, That he will give his Angels charge over thee to keep thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with their hands they shall lift thee up, lest at anytime thou shouldest dash thy foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a little season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus returned by the power of the spirit into Galilee: and there went a fame of him throughout all the region round about:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he taught in their Synagogues, and was honored of all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Nazareth where he had been brought up, and (as his custom was) went into the Synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was delivered unto him the book of the Prophet Isaiah: and when he had opened the book, he found the place, where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he hath anointed me, that I should preach the Gospel to the poor: he hath sent me, that I should heal the brokenhearted, that I should preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, that I should set at liberty them that are bruised:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And that I should preach the acceptable year of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he closed the book, and gave it again to the minister, and sat down: and the eyes of all that were in the Synagogue were fastened on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to say unto them, This day is the Scripture fulfilled in your ears.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words, which proceeded out of his mouth, and said, Is not this Joseph’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Ye will surely say unto me this Proverb, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do it here likewise in thine own country.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said, Verily I say unto you, No Prophet is accepted in his own country.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you of a truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when heaven was shut three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land:
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But unto none of them was Elijah sent, save into Zarephath, a city of Sidon, unto a certain widow.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Also many lepers were in Israel, in the time of Elisha the Prophet: yet none of them was made clean, saving Naaman the Syrian.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then all that were in the Synagogue, when they heard it, were filled with wrath,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And rose up, and thrust him out of the city, and led him unto the edge of the hill, whereon their city was built, to cast him down headlong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he passed through the midst of them, and went his way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And came down into Capernaum a city of Galilee, and there taught them on the Sabbath days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were astonied at his doctrine: for his word was with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the Synagogue there was a man which had a spirit of an unclean devil, which cried with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Oh, what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know who thou art, even the Holy one of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him. Then the devil throwing him in the midst of them, came out of him, and hurt him nothing at all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So fear came on them all, and they spake among themselves, saying, What thing is this: for with authority and power he commandeth the foul spirits, and they come out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fame of him spread abroad throughout all the places of the country round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he rose up, and came out of the Synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. And Simon’s wife’s mother was taken with a great fever, and they required him for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he stood over her, and rebuked the fever, and it left her, and immediately she arose, and ministered unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the Sun setting, all they that had sick folks of divers diseases, brought them unto him, and he laid his hands on everyone of them, and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And devils also came out of many, crying, and saying, Thou art that Christ that Son of God: but he rebuked them, and suffered them not to say that they knew him to be that Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And when it was day, he departed, and went forth into a desert place, and the people sought him, and came to him, and kept him that he should not depart from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, Surely I must also preach the kingdom of God to other cities: for therefore am I sent.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he preached in the Synagogues of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it came to pass, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, that he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And saw two ships stand by the lakeside, but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon’s, and required him that he would thrust off a little from the land: and he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets to make a draught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon answered, and said unto him, Master, we have travailed sore all night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had so done, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes, so that their net brake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they beckoned to their partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them, who came then, and filled both the ships, that they did sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus knees, saying, Lord, go from me: for I am a sinful man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was utterly astonied, and all that were with him, for the draught of fishes which they took.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so was also James and John the sons of Zebedee, which were companions with Simon. Then Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not: from henceforth thou shalt catch men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought the ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, as he was in a certain city, behold, there was a man full of leprosy, and when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he stretched forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will, be thou clean. And immediately the leprosy departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded him that he should tell it no man: but Go, saith he, and show thyself to the Priest, and offer for thy cleansing, as Moses hath commanded, for a witness unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so much more went there a fame abroad of him, and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed of him of their infirmities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he kept himself apart in the wilderness, and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on a certain day, as he was teaching, that the Pharisees and doctors of the Law sat by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judea, and Jerusalem, and the power of the Lord was in him, to heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, men brought a man lying in a bed, which was taken with a palsy, and they sought means to bring him in, and to lay him before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in, because of the press, they went up on the house, and let him down through the tiling, bed and all, in the midst before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this that speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus perceived their reasoning he answered, and said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether is easier to say, Thy sins are forgiven thee, or to say, Rise and walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath authority to forgive sins in earth, (he said unto the sick of the palsy) I say to thee, Arise: take up thy bed, and go into thine house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up his bed whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed, and praised God, and were filled with fear, saying, Doubtless we have seen strange things today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after that, he went forth and saw a Publican named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Levi made him a great feast in his own house, where there was a great company of Publicans, and of others that sat at table with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they that were Scribes and Pharisees among them, murmured against his disciples, saying, Why eat ye and drink ye with Publicans and sinners?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, They that are whole, need not the Physician, but they that are sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and pray, and the disciples of the Pharisees also, but thine eat and drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Can ye make the children of the wedding chamber to fast, as long as the bridegroom is with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the days will come, even when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them: then shall they fast in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he spake also unto them a parable, No man putteth a piece of a new garment into an old vesture: for then the new renteth it, and the piece taken out of the new, agreeth not with the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also no man poureth new wine into old vessels: for then the new wine will break the vessels, and it will run out, and the vessels will perish:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But new wine must be poured into new vessels: so both are preserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also no man that drinketh old wine, straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is more profitable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on a second solemn Sabbath, that he went through the corn fields, and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, and rubbed them in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered them, and said, Have ye not read this, that David did when he himself was an hungered, and they which were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How he went into the house of God, and took, and ate the showbread, and gave also to them which were with him, which was not lawful to eat, but for the Priests only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, The Son of man is Lord also of the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came to pass also on another Sabbath, that he entered into the Synagogue, and taught, and there was a man, whose right hand was dried up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the Sabbath day, that they might find an accusation against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Arise, and stand up in the midst. And he arose, and stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you a question, Whether is it lawful on the Sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he beheld them all in compass, and said unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he did so, and his hand was restored again, as whole as the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they were filled full of madness, and communed one with another, what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days, that he went into a mountain to pray, and spent the night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was day, he called his disciples, and of them he chose twelve which also he called Apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Simon whom he named also Peter, and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew and Thomas: James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zealous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas James’ brother, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came down with them, and stood in a plain place with the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judea, and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that were vexed with foul spirits, and they were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lifted up his eyes upon his disciples, and said, Blessed be ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be satisfied: blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are ye when men hate you, and when they separate you, and revile you, and put out your name as evil, for the Son of man’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice ye in that day, and be glad: for behold, your reward is great in heaven: for after this manner their fathers did to the Prophets:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe be to you that are rich: for ye have received your consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you that are full: for ye shall hunger. Woe be to you that now laugh: for ye shall wail and weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you when all men speak well of you: for so did their fathers to the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies: do well to them which hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek, offer also the other, and him that taketh away thy cloak, forbid not to take thy coat also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to every man that asketh of thee: and of him that taketh away the things that be thine, ask them not again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as ye would that men should do to you, so do ye to them likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if ye love them which love you, what thank shall ye have? for even the sinners love those that love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye do good for them which do good for you, what thank shall ye have? for even the sinners do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank shall ye have? for even the sinners lend to sinners, to receive the like.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, looking for nothing again, and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the most High: for he is kind unto the unkind, and to the evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give, and it shall be given unto you: a good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over shall men give into your bosom: for with what measure ye mete, with the same shall men mete to you again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciple is not above the master: but whosoever will be a perfect disciple, shall be as his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why seest thou a mote in thy brother’s eye, and considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou seest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Hypocrite, cast out the beam out of thine own eye first, and then shalt thou see perfectly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is not a good tree that bringeth forth evil fruit: neither an evil tree, that bringeth forth good fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every tree is known by his own fruit: for neither of thorns gather men figs, nor of bushes gather they grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But why call ye me Lord, Lord, and do not the things that I speak?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my words, and doeth the same, I will show you to whom he is like:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is like a man which built an house, and dug deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the waters arose, the flood beat upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was grounded upon a rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that heareth and doeth not, is like a man that built an house upon the earth without foundation, against which the flood did beat, and it fell by and by: and the fall of that house was great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain Centurion’s servant was sick and ready to die, which was dear unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the Elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come, and heal his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came to Jesus, and besought him instantly, saying that he was worthy that he should do this for him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he loveth, said they, our nation, and he hath built us a Synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went with them: but when he was now not far from the house, the Centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore I thought not myself worthy to come unto thee: but say the word, and my servant shall be whole:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I likewise am a man set under authority, and have under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth: and to another, Come, and he cometh: and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned him, and said to the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no not in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they that were sent, turned back to the house, they found the servant that was sick, whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain, and many of his disciples went with him, and a great multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he came near to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, who was the only begotten son of his mother, which was a widow, and much people of the city was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went and touched the coffin (and they that bare him, stood still) and he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that was dead, sat up, and began to speak, and he delivered him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there came a fear on them all, and they glorified God, saying, A great Prophet is risen among us, and God hath visited his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this rumor of him went forth throughout all Judea, and throughout all the region round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples of John showed him of all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So John called unto him two certain men of his disciples, and sent them to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come, or shall we wait for another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come, or shall we wait for another?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at that time, he cured many of their sicknesses, and plagues, and of evil spirits, and unto many blind men he gave sight freely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto them, Go your ways and show John, what things ye have seen and heard, that the blind see, the halt go, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor receive the Gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And blessed is he, that shall not be offended in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people of John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what went ye out to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they which are gorgeously appareled, and live delicately, are in Kings’ courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what went ye forth to see? A Prophet? yea, I say to you, and greater than a Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is he of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, there is no greater Prophet than John, among them that are begotten of women: nevertheless, he that is the least in the kingdom of God, is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people that heard, and the Publicans justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the expounders of the Law despised the counsel of God against themselves, and were not baptized of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, Whereunto shall I liken the men of this generation? and what thing are they like unto?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are like unto little children sitting in the marketplace, and crying one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced: we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John Baptist came neither eating bread, nor drinking wine: and ye say, He hath the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of man is come, and eateth, and drinketh: and ye say, Behold, a man which is a glutton, and a drinker of wine, a friend of Publicans and sinners:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But wisdom is justified of all her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him: and he went into the Pharisee’s house, and sat down at table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus sat at table in the Pharisee’s house, she brought a box of ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she stood at his feet behind him weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee which bade him, saw it, he spake within himself, saying, If this man were a Prophet, he would surely have known who, and what manner of woman this is which toucheth him: for she is a sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he said, Master, say on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a certain lender which had two debtors: the one ought five hundred pence, and the other fifty:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had nothing to pay, he forgave them both: Which of them therefore, tell me, will love him most?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, and said, I suppose that he to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou hast truly judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, and thou gavest me no water to my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wiped them with the hairs of her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou gavest me no kiss: but she, since the time I came in, hath not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine head with oil thou didst not anoint: but she hath anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore I say unto thee, many sins are forgiven her: for she loved much. To whom a little is forgiven, he doth love a little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that sat at table with him, began to say within themselves, Who is this that even forgiveth sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee: go in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass afterward, that he himself went through every city and town, preaching and publishing the kingdom of God, and the twelve were with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain women, which were healed of evil spirits, and infirmities, as Mary which was called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others which ministered unto him of their substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when much people were gathered together, and were come unto him out of all cities, he spake by a parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sower went out to sow his seed, and as he sowed, some fell by the wayside, and it was trodden under feet, and the fowls of heaven devoured it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell on the stones, and when it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moistness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit, an hundredfold. And as he said these things, he cried, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples asked him, demanding what parable that was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Unto you it is given to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but to others in parables, that when they see, they should not see, and when they hear, they should not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The parable is this, The seed is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they that are beside the way, are they that hear: afterward cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe, and be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they that are on the stones, are they which when they have heard, receive the word with joy: but they have no roots: which for a while believe, but in the time of temptation go away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that which fell among thorns, are they which have heard, and after their departure are choked with cares and with riches, and voluptuous living, and bring forth no fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that which fell in good ground, are they which with an honest and good heart hear the word, and keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it under a vessel, neither putteth it under the bed, but setteth it on a candlestick, that they that enter in, may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is secret, that shall not be evident: neither anything hid, that shall not be known, and come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given: and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which it seemeth that he hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came to him his mother and his brethren, and could not come near to him for the press.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was told him by certain which said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, and would see thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples, and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they sailed, he fell asleep, and there came down a storm of wind on the lake, and they were filled with water, and were in jeopardy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, Master, we perish. And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and the waves of water: and they ceased, and it was calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Where is your faith? and they feared, and wondered among themselves, saying, Who is this that commandeth both the winds and water, and they obey him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sailed unto the region of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he went out to land, there met him a certain man out of the city, which had devils long time, and he wore no garment, neither abode in house, but in the graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus the son of God the most High? I beseech thee torment me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he commanded the foul spirit to come out of the man: (for oft times he had caught him: therefore he was bound with chains, and kept in fetters: but he brake the bands, and was carried of the devil into wildernesses.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked him, saying, What is thy name? and he said, Legion, because many devils were entered into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they besought him, that he would not command them to go out into the deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was thereby an herd of many swine feeding on an hill: and the devils besought him, that he would suffer them to enter into them. So he suffered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then went the devils out of the man, and entered into the swine: and the herd was carried with violence from a steep down place into the lake, and was choked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the herdsmen saw what was done, they fled: and when they were departed, they told it in the city and in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came out to see what was done, and came to Jesus, and found the man, out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also which saw it, told them by what means he that was possessed with the devil, was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole multitude of the country about the Gadarenes, besought him that he would depart from them: for they were taken with a great fear: and he went into the ship, and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man, out of whom the devils were departed, besought him that he might be with him: but Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Return into thine own house, and show what great things God hath done to thee. So he went his way, and preached throughout all the city, what great things Jesus had done unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Jesus was come again, that the people received him: for they all waited for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was the ruler of the Synagogue, who fell down at Jesus’ feet, and besought him that he would come into his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had but a daughter only, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying (and as he went, the people thronged him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a woman having an issue of blood, twelve years long, which had spent all her substance upon physicians, and could not be healed of any:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she came behind him, she touched the hem of his garment, and immediately her issue of blood stanched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, Who is it that hath touched me? When every man denied, Peter said and they that were with him, Master, the multitude thrust thee, and tread on thee, and sayest thou, Who hath touched me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, Someone hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling, and fell down before him, and told him before all the people: for what cause she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto her, Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath saved thee: go in peace.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he yet spake, there came one from the ruler of the Synagogue’s house, which said to him, Thy daughter is dead: disease not the Master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, he answered him, saying, Fear not: believe only, and she shall be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he went into the house, he suffered no man to go in with him, save Peter, and James, and John, and the father and mother of the maid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all wept, and sorrowed for her: but he said, Weep not: for she is not dead, but sleepeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he thrust them all out, and took her by the hand, and cried, saying, Maid, arise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her spirit came again, and she rose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then her parents were astonied: but he commanded them that they should tell no man what was done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then called he his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to heal diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent them forth to preach the kingdom of God, and to cure the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, Take nothing to your journey, neither staves, nor scrip, neither bread, nor silver, neither have two coats apiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how many soever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out, and went through every town preaching the Gospel, and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the Tetrarch heard of all that was done by him: and he doubted, because that it was said of some, that John was risen again from the dead:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of some, that Elijah had appeared: and of some, that one of the old Prophets was risen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod said, John have I beheaded: who then is this of whom I hear such things? and he desired to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Apostles returned, they told him what great things they had done. Then he took them to him, and went aside into a solitary place, near to the city called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the people knew it, they followed him: and he received them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of God, and healed them that had need to be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the day began to wear away, the twelve came, and said unto him, Send the people away, that they may go into the towns and villages round about, and lodge, and get meat: for we are here in a desert place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they said, We have no more but five loaves and two fishes, except we should go and buy meat for all this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they were about five thousand men. Then he said to his disciples, Cause them to sit down by fifties in a company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did so, and caused all to sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looked up to heaven, and blessed them, and brake, and gave to the disciples, to set before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they did all eat, and were satisfied: and there was taken up of that remained to them, twelve baskets full of broken meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples were with him: and he asked them, saying, Whom say the people that I am?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, and said, John Baptist: and others say, Elijah: and some say, that one of the old Prophets is risen again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, But whom say ye that I am? Peter answered, and said: That Christ of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he warned and commanded them, that they should tell that to no man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be reproved of the Elders, and of the high Priests and Scribes, and be slain, and the third day rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them all, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever will save his life, shall lose it: and whosoever shall lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what advantageth it a man, if he win the whole world, and destroy himself, or lose himself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me, and of my words, of him shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he shall come in his glory, and in the glory of the Father, and of the holy Angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I tell you of a surety, there be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass about an eight days after those words, that he took Peter and John, and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was changed, and his garment was white and glistered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, two men talked with him, which were Moses and Elijah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which appeared in glory, and told of his departing, which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and they that were with him, were heavy with sleep, and when they awoke, they saw his glory, and the two men standing with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: let us therefore make three tabernacles, one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah, and wist not what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he thus spake, there came a cloud and overshadowed them, and they feared when they were entering into the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is that my beloved Son, hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone: and they kept it close, and told no man in those days any of those things which they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the next day, as they came down from the mountain, much people met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a man of the company cried out, saying, Master, I beseech thee, behold my son: for he is all that I have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lo, a spirit taketh him, and suddenly he crieth, and he teareth him, that he foameth, and hardly departeth from him, when he hath bruised him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have besought thy disciples to cast him out, but they could not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said, O generation faithless, and crooked, how long now shall I be with you, and suffer you? bring thy son hither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was yet coming, the devil rent him, and tore him: and Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God: and while they all wondered at all things which Jesus did, he said unto his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mark these words diligently: for it shall come to pass, that the son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they understood not that word: for it was hid from them, so that they could not perceive it: and they feared to ask him of that word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there arose a disputation among them, which of them should be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw the thoughts of their hearts, he took a little child, and set him by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Whosoever receiveth this little child in my Name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, he shall be great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John answered and said, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy Name, and we forbad him, because he followeth thee not with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, Forbid ye him not: for he that is not against us, is with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the days were accomplished, that he should be received up, he settled himself fully to go to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sent messengers before him: and they went and entered into a town of the Samaritans, to prepare him lodging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they would not receive him, because his behavior was as though he would go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when his disciples, James and John saw it, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command, that fire come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elijah did?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned about, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not of what spirit ye are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them. Then they went to another town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that as they went in the way, a certain man said unto him, I will follow thee, Lord, whithersoever thou goest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven nests, but the Son of man hath not whereon to lay his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto another, Follow me. And the same said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou, and preach the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then another said, I will follow thee, Lord: but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at mine house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, No man that putteth his hand to the plough, and looketh back, is apt to the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, the Lord appointed other seventy also, and sent them, two and two before him into every city and place, whither he himself should come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, The harvest is great, but the laborers are few: pray therefore the Lord of the harvest to send forth laborers into his harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear no bag, neither scrip, nor shoes, and salute no man by the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace be to this house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon him, if not, it shall turn to you again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in that house tarry still, eating and drinking such things as by them shall be set before you: for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Go not from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But into whatsoever city ye shall enter, if they receive you, eat such things as are set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And heal the sick that are there, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come near unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But into whatsoever city ye shall enter, if they will not receive you, go your ways out into the streets of the same, and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the very dust, which cleaveth on us of your city, we wipe off against you: notwithstanding know this, that the kingdom of God was come near unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say to you, that it shall be easier in that day for them of Sodom, than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to thee, Chorazin: woe be to thee, Bethsaida: for if the miracles had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while agone repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it shall be easier for Tyre, and Sidon, at the judgment, than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted to heaven, shalt be thrust down to hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that heareth you, heareth me: and he that despiseth you, despiseth me: and he that despiseth me, despiseth him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seventy turned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subdued to us through thy Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, I saw Satan, like lightning, fall down from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I give unto you power to tread on Serpents, and Scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subdued unto you: but rather rejoice, because your names are written in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same hour rejoiced Jesus in the spirit, and said, I confess unto thee, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and understanding, and hast revealed them to babes: even so, Father, because it so pleased thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things are given me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the son is, but the Father: neither who the Father is, save the Son, and he to whom the Son will reveal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he turned to his disciples, and said secretly, Blessed are the eyes, which see that ye see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that many Prophets and Kings have desired to see those things, which ye see, and have not seen them: and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, a certain Lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, What is written in the Law? how readest thou?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, Thou shalt love thy Lord God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy thought, and thy neighbor as thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, Who is then my neighbor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said, A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, and they robbed him of his raiment, and wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now so it fell out, that there came down a certain Priest that same way, and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator
