verses.text: And likewise also a Levite, when he was come near to the place, went and looked on him, and passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came near unto him, and when he saw him, he had compassion on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And went to him, and bound up his wounds and poured in oil and wine, and put him on his own beast, and brought him to an Inn, and made provision for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gave them to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him, and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will recompense thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbor unto him that fell among the thieves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, He that showed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain town, and a certain woman named Martha, received him into her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his preaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Master, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone? bid her therefore, that she help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou carest, and art troubled about many things:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one thing is needful, Mary hath chosen the good part, which shall not be taken away from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, that as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, hallowed be thy Name. Thy kingdom come: Let thy will be done, even in earth, as it is in heaven:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our daily bread give us for the day:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And forgive us our sins: for even we forgive every man that is indebted to us: And lead us not into temptation: but deliver us from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go to him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a friend of mine is come out of the way to me, and I have nothing to set before him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he within should answer, and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed: I cannot rise and give them to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, Though he would not arise and give him, because he is his friend, yet doubtless because of his importunity, he would rise and give him as many as he needed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you: seek, and ye shall find: knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone that asketh, receiveth: and he that seeketh, findeth: and to him that knocketh, it shall be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or if he ask a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he ask an egg, will he give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye then which are evil, can give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your heavenly Father give the holy Ghost to them that desire him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cast out a devil which was dumb: and when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake, and the people wondered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And others tempted him, seeking of him a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts, and said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself, shall be desolate, and an house divided against an house, falleth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand, because ye say that I cast out devils through Beelzebub?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I through Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore shall they be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I by the finger of God cast out devils, doubtless the kingdom of God is come unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, the things that he possesseth, are in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when a stronger than he cometh upon him, and overcometh him: he taketh from him all his armor wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is not with me, is against me: and he that gathereth not with me, scattereth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest: and when he findeth none, he saith, I will return unto mine house whence I came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he cometh, he findeth it swept and garnished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirits worse than himself: and they enter in, and dwell there: so the last state of that man is worse than the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass as he said these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, Yea, rather blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This is a wicked generation: they seek a sign, and there shall no sign be given them, but the sign of Jonah the Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites: so shall also the son of man be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Queen of the South shall rise in judgment, with the men of this generation, and shall condemn them: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah: and behold, a greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man when he hath lighted a candle, putteth it in a privy place, neither under a bushel: but on a candlestick, that they which come in, may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, then is thy whole body light: but if thine eye be evil, then thy body is dark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed therefore, that the light which is in thee, be not darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore thy whole body shall be light, having no part dark, then shall all be light, even as when a candle doth light thee with the brightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed before dinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, Indeed ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup, and of the platter: but the inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye fools, did not he that made that which is without, make that which is within also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, give alms of those things which you have, and behold, all things shall be clean unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe be to you, Pharisees: for ye tithe the mint and the rue, and all manner herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to have left the other undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you, Pharisees: for ye love the uppermost seats in the Synagogues, and greetings in the markets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you, Scribes and Pharisees hypocrites: for ye are as graves which appear not, and the men that walk over them, perceive not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered one of the Lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou puttest us to rebuke also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Woe be to you also, ye Lawyers: for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you: for ye build the sepulchers of the Prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly ye bear witness, and allow the deeds of your fathers: for they killed them, and ye build their sepulchers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore said the wisdom of God, I will send them Prophets and Apostles, and of them they shall slay, and persecute away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That the blood of all the Prophets, shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zechariah, which was slain between the altar and the Temple: verily I say unto you, it shall be required of this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe be to you, Lawyers: for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that came in, ye forbade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he said these things unto them, the Scribes and Pharisees began to urge him sore, and to provoke him to speak of many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something of his mouth, whereby they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the meantime, there gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, so that they trod one another: and he began to say unto his disciples first, Take heed to yourselves of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed: neither hid, that shall not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness, it shall be heard in the light: and that which ye have spoken in the ear, in secret places, shall be preached on the houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you, my friends, be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that are not able to do anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will forewarn you, whom ye shall fear: fear him which after he hath killed, hath power to cast into hell: yea, I say unto you, him fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not five sparrows bought for two farthings, and yet not one of them is forgotten before God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, and all the hairs of your head are numbered: fear not therefore: ye are more of value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man confess also before the Angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that shall deny me before men, shall be denied before the Angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that shall blaspheme the holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they shall bring you unto the Synagogues, and unto the rulers and Princes, take no thought how, or what thing ye shall answer, or what ye shall speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour, what ye ought to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the company said unto him, Master, bid my brother divide the inheritance with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Man, who made me a judge, or a divider over you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for though a man have abundance, yet his life standeth not in his riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put forth a parable unto them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth fruits plenteously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he thought with himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where I may lay up my fruits?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, This will I do, I will pull down my barns, and build greater, and therein will I gather all my fruits, and my goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years, live at ease, eat, drink, and take thy pastime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said unto him, O fool, this night will they fetch away thy soul from thee: then whose shall those things be which thou hast provided?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So is he that gathereth riches to himself, and is not rich in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake unto his disciples, Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat: neither for your body, what ye shall put on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The life is more than meat: and the body more than the raiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap: which neither have storehouse nor barn, and yet God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than fowls?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And which of you with taking thought, can add to his stature one cubit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye then be not able to do the least thing, why take ye thought for the remnant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the lilies how they grow: they labor not, neither spin they: yet I say unto you, that Solomon himself in all his royalty was not clothed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then God so clothe the grass which is today in the field, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore ask not what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither hang you in suspense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all such things the people of the world seek for: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rather seek ye after the kingdom of God, and all these things shall be cast upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear not, little flock: for it is your Father’s pleasure to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell that ye have, and give alms: make you bags which wax not old: a treasure that can never fail in heaven, where no thief cometh neither moth corrupteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your hearts be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your loins be girded about, and your lights burning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye yourselves like unto men that wait for their master, when he will return from the wedding, that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open unto him immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the Lord when he cometh shall find waking: verily I say unto you, he will gird himself about, and make them to sit down at table, and will come forth, and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and shall find them so, blessed are those servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now understand this, that if the good man of the house had known at what hour the thief would have come, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be dug through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye also prepared therefore: for the Son of man will come at an hour when ye think not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said unto him, Master, tellest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, Who is a faithful steward and wise, whom the master shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of meat in season?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant, whom his master when he cometh, shall find so doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of a truth, I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that servant say in his heart, My master doth defer his coming, and shall begin to smite the servants, and maidens, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The master of that servant will come in a day when he thinketh not, and at an hour when he is not aware of, and will cut him off, and give him his portion with the unbelievers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that servant that knew his master’s will, and prepared not himself, neither did according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that knew it not, and yet did commit things worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few stripes: for unto whomsoever much is given, of him shall be much required, and to whom men much commit, the more of him will they ask.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am come to put fire on the earth, and what is my desire, if it be already kindled?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding I must be baptized with a baptism, and how am I grieved till it be ended?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Think ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, nay, but rather debate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from henceforth there shall be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father shall be divided against the son, and the son against the father: the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother: the mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to the people, When ye see a cloud rise out of the West, straightway ye say, A shower cometh: and so it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye see the South wind blow, ye say, that it will be hot: and it cometh to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the earth, and of the sky: but why discern ye not this time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, and why judge ye not of yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While thou goest with thine adversary to the ruler, as thou art in the way, give diligence in the way, that thou mayest be delivered from him, lest he draw thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the jailer, and the jailer cast thee into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the utmost mite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were certain men present at the same season, that showed him of the Galileans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said unto them, Suppose ye, that these Galileans were greater sinners than all the other Galileans, because they have suffered such things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, nay: but except ye amend your lives, ye shall all likewise perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or think you that those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and slew them, were sinners above all men that dwell in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, nay: but except ye amend your lives, ye shall all likewise perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spake also this parable, A certain man had a fig tree, planted in his vineyard: and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to the dresser of his vineyard, Behold, this three years have I come and sought fruit of this fig tree, and find none: cut it down: why keepeth it also the ground barren?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, and said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I dig round about it, and dung it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it bear fruit, well: if not, then after thou shalt cut it down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taught in one of the Synagogues on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could not lift up herself in any wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her to him, and said to her, Woman, thou art loosed from thy disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he laid his hands on her, and immediately she was made straight again, and glorified God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ruler of the Synagogue answered with indignation, because that Jesus healed on the Sabbath day, and said unto the people, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered him the Lord, and said, Hypocrite, doth not each one of you on the Sabbath day loose his ox or his ass from the stall, and lead him away to the water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ought not this daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound, lo, eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: but all the people rejoiced at all the excellent things that were done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he, What is the kingdom of God like? or whereto shall I compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his garden, and it grew, and waxed a great tree, and the fowls of the heaven made nests in the branches thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three pecks of flour, till all was leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went through all cities and towns, teaching, and journeying towards Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said one unto him, Lord, are there few that shall be saved? And he said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the good man of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye began to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us, and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are: depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the Prophets in the kingdom of God, and yourselves thrust out at doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall come many from the East, and from the West, and from the North, and from the South, and shall sit at Table in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there are last, which shall be first, and there are first, which shall be last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day there came certain Pharisees, and said unto him, Depart, and go hence: for Herod will kill thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he unto them, Go ye and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and will heal still today, and tomorrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I must walk today, and tomorrow, and the day following: for it cannot be that a Prophet should perish out of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the Prophets, and stonest them that are sent to thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, as the hen gathered her brood under her wings, and ye would not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I tell you, ye shall not see me until the time come that ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that when he was entered into the house of one of the chief Pharisees on the Sabbath day, to eat bread, they watched him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a certain man before him, which had the dropsy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answering, spake unto the Lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they held their peace. Then he took him, and healed him, and let him go,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And answered them, saying, Which of you shall have an ass, or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the Sabbath day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they could not answer him again to those things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spake also a parable to the guests, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms, and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou shalt be bidden of any man to a wedding, set not thyself down in the chiefest place, lest a more honorable man than thou be bidden of him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that bade both him and thee, come, and say to thee, Give this man room, and thou then begin with shame to take the lowest room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room, that when he that bade thee, cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, sit up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at table with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whosoever exalteth himself, shall be brought low, and he that humbleth himself, shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he also to him that had bidden him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor the rich neighbors, lest they also bid thee again, and a recompense be made thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame and the blind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt be blessed, because they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when one of them that sat at table heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that eateth bread in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to him, A certain man made a great supper, and bade many,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come: for all things are now ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all with one mind began to make excuse: The first said unto him, I have bought a farm, and I must needs go out and see it: I pray thee have me excused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that servant returned, and showed his master these things. Then was the good man of the house angry, and said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the master said to the servant, Go out into the highways, and hedges, and compel them to come in, that mine house may be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, that none of those men which were bidden, shall taste of my supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there went great multitudes with him, and he turned and said unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters: yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whosoever beareth not his cross, and cometh after me, cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which of you minding to build a tower, sitting not down before, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to perform it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lest that after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to perform it, all that behold it, begin to mock him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, This man began to build, and was not able to make an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what King going to make war against another King, sitteth not down first, and taketh counsel, whether he be able with ten thousand, to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else while he is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise, whosoever he be of you, that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good: but if salt have lost his savor, wherewith shall it be salted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is neither meet for the land, nor yet for the dunghill, but men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then resorted unto him all the Publicans and sinners, to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Pharisees and Scribes murmured, saying, He receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then spake he this parable to them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What man of you having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbors, saying unto them, Rejoice with me: for I have found my sheep which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven for one sinner that converteth, more than for ninety and nine just men, which need none amendment of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Either what woman having ten groats, if she lose one groat, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she hath found it, she calleth her friends, and neighbors, saying, Rejoice with me: for I have found the groat which I had lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the Angels of God, for one sinner that converteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said moreover, A certain man had two sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of the goods that falleth to me. So he divided unto them his substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So not many days after, when the younger son had gathered all together, he took his journey into a far country, and there he wasted his goods with riotous living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had spent all, there arose a great dearth throughout that land, and he began to be in necessity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went and clave to a citizen of that country, and he sent him to his farm, to feed swine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine ate: but no man gave them him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to himself, and said, How many hired servants at my father’s have bread enough, and I die for hunger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will rise and go to my father, and say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thine hired servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he arose and came to his father, and when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And bring the fat calf, and kill him, and let us eat, and be merry:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this my son was dead, and is alive again: and he was lost, but he is found. And they began to be merry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the elder brother was in the field, and when he came and drew near to the house, he heard melody, and dancing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And called one of his servants, and asked what those things meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Thy brother is come, and thy father hath killed the fat calf, because he hath received him safe and sound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and entreated him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said to his father, Lo, these many years have I done thee service, neither brake I at anytime thy commandment, and yet thou never gavest me a kid that I might make merry with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this thy son was come, which hath devoured thy goods with harlots, thou hast for his sake killed the fat calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Son thou art ever with me, and all that I have, is thine. It was meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for this thy brother was dead, and is alive again: and he was lost, but he is found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward, and he was accused unto him, that he wasted his goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? Give an account of thy stewardship: for thou mayest be no longer steward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my master taketh away from me the stewardship. I cannot dig, and to beg I am ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what I will do, that when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then called he unto him everyone of his master’s debtors, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my master?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said to him, Take thy writing, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to another, How much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. Then he said to him, Take thy writing and write fourscore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely. Wherefore the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say unto you, Make you friends with the riches of iniquity, that when ye shall want, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is faithful in the least, he is also faithful in much: and he that is unjust in the least, is unjust also in much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then ye have not been faithful in the wicked riches, who will trust you in the true treasure?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye have not been faithful in another man’s goods, who shall give you that which is yours?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters: for either he shall hate the one, and love the other: or else he shall lean to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these things heard the Pharisees also which were covetous, and they scoffed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Ye are they, which justify yourselves before men: but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men, is abomination in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Law and the Prophets endured until John: and since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is more easy that heaven and earth should pass away, than that one tittle of the Law should fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, commiteth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband, commiteth adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared well and delicately every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate full of sores,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And desired to be refreshed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table: yea, and the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so that the beggar died, and was carried by the Angels into Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being in hell in torments, he lifted up his eyes, and saw Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cried, and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue: for I am tormented in this flame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy pleasures, and likewise Lazarus pains: now therefore is he comforted, and thou art tormented.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides all this, between you and us there is a great gulf set, so that they which would go from hence to you, cannot: neither can they come from thence to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, I pray thee therefore father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For I have five brethren) that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said unto him, They have Moses and the Prophets: let them hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one came unto them from the dead, they will amend their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the Prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rise from the dead again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he to his disciples, It cannot be avoided, but that offences will come, but woe be to him by whom they come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is better for him that a great millstone were hanged about his neck, and that he were cast into the sea, then that he should offend one of these little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed to yourselves: if thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him: and if he repent, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though he sin against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turn again to thee, saying, it repenteth me, thou shalt forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, If ye had faith, as much as is a grain of mustard seed, and should say unto this mulberry tree, Pluck thyself up by the roots, and plant thyself in the sea, it should even obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is it also of you, that having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, would say unto him by and by, when he were come from the field, Go, and sit down at table,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And would not rather say to him, Dress wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken, and afterward eat thou, and drink thou?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Doth he thank that servant, because he did that which was commanded unto him? I trow not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise ye, when ye have done all those things, which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was when he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria, and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he entered into a certain town, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they lifted up their voices and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go, show yourselves unto the Priests. And it came to pass, that as they went, they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice praised God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fell down on his face at his feet, and gave him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered, and said, Are there not ten cleansed? but where are the nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is none found that returned to give God praise, save this stranger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Arise, go thy way, thy faith hath saved thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them, and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither shall men say, Lo here, or lo there: for behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto the disciples, the days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall say to you, Behold here, or behold there: but go not thither, neither follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven, so shall the Son of man be in his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first must he suffer many things and be reproved of this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as it was in the days of Noah, so shall it be in the days of the Son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ate, they drank, they married wives, and gave in marriage unto the day that Noah went into the Ark: and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot: They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the day that Lot went out of Sodom, it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these examples shall it be in the day when the son of man revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that day he that is upon the house, and his stuff in the house, let him not come down to take it out: and he that is in the field likewise, let him not turn back to that he left behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever will seek to save his soul, shall loose it: and whosoever shall loose it, shall get it life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, in that night there shall be two in one bed: the one shall be received, and the other shall be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women shall be grinding together, the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two shall be in the field: one shall be received, and another shall be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered, and said to him, Where, Lord? And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body is, thither shall also the eagles be gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake also a parable unto them, to this end, that they ought always to pray, and not to wax faint,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, there was a judge in a certain city, which feared not God, neither reverenced man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a widow in that city, which came unto him, saying, Do me justice against mine adversary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he would not of a long time: but afterward he said with himself, Though I fear not God, nor reverence man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will do her right, lest at the last she come and make me weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, Hear what the unrighteous judge saith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now shall not God avenge his elect, which cry day and night unto him, yea, though he suffer long for them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you he will avenge them quickly: but when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spake also this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were just, and despised others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two men went up into the Temple to pray: the one a Pharisee, and the other a Publican.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, O God, I thank thee that I am not as other men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this Publican.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice in the week: I give tithe of all that ever I possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Publican standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes to heaven, but smote his breast, saying, O God, be merciful to me a sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, this man departed to his house, justified rather than the other: for every man that exalteth himself shall be brought low, and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought unto him also babes that he should touch them. And when his disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Suffer the babes to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, whosoever receiveth not the kingdom of God as a babe, he shall not enter therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what ought I do, to inherit eternal life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, even God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou knowest the commandments, Thou shalt not commit adultery: Thou shalt not kill: Thou shalt not steal: Thou shalt not bear false witness: Honor thy father and thy mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard that, he said unto him, yet lackest thou one thing, Sell all that ever thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard those things, he was very heavy: for he was marvelous rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus saw him very sorrowful, he said, With what difficulty shall they that have riches, enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said they that heard it, And who then shall be saved?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, The things which are impossible with men, are possible with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, there is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children for the kingdom of God’s sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which shall not receive much more in this world, and in the world to come life everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things shall be fulfilled to the Son of man, that are written by the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and shall be spiteful entreated, and shall be spitted on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they have scourged him, they will put him to death: but the third day he shall rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they understood none of these things, and this saying was hid from them, neither perceived they the things, which were spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that as he was come near unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the wayside, begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he heard the people pass by, he asked what it meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto him, that Jesus of Nazareth passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cried, saying, Jesus the Son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they which went before, rebuked him that he should hold his peace, but he cried much more, O Son of David have mercy on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be brought unto him. And when he was come near, he asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, What wilt thou that I do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then immediately he received his sight, and followed him, praising God: and all the people, when they saw this, gave praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus entered and passed through Jericho,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief receiver of the tribute, and he was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sought to see Jesus, who he should be, and could not for the press, because he was of a low stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore he ran before, and climbed up into a wild fig tree, that he might see him: for he should come that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, come down at once: for today I must abide at thine house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came down hastily, and received him joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all they saw it, they murmured, saying, that he was gone in to lodge with a sinful man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zacchaeus stood forth, and said unto the Lord, Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor: and if I have taken from any man by forged cavillation, I restore him fourfold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, This day is salvation come unto this house, forasmuch as he is also become the son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the son of man is come to seek, and to save that which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they heard these things, he continued and spake a parable, because he was near to Jerusalem, and because also they thought that the kingdom of God should shortly appear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said therefore, A certain noble man went into a far country, to receive for himself a kingdom, and so to come again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pieces of money, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his citizens hated him, and sent an ambassage after him, saying, We will not have this man to reign over us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when he was come again, and had received his kingdom, that he commanded the servants to be called to him, to whom he gave his money, that he might know what every man had gained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy piece hath increased ten pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him, Well, good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little thing, take thou authority over ten cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second came, saying, Lord, thy piece hath increased five pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to the same he said, Be thou also ruler over five cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the other came, and said, Lord, behold thy piece, which I have laid up in a napkin:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I feared thee, because thou art a straight man: thou takest up that thou laidst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto him, Of thine own mouth will I judge thee, O evil servant. Thou knewest that I am a straight man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required it with vantage?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them that stood by, Take from him that piece, and give it him that hath ten pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pieces.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, that unto all them that have, it shall be given: and from him that hath not, even that he hath, shall be taken from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay them before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he went forth before, ascending up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when he was come near to Bethphage, and Bethany, besides the mount which is called the mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Go ye to the town which is before you, wherein as soon as ye are come, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat: loose him, and bring him hither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any ask you, why ye loose him, thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they that were sent, went their way, and found it as he had said unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought him to Jesus, and they cast their garments on the colt, and set Jesus thereon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was now come near to the going down of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice, and to praise God with a loud voice, for all the great works that they had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Blessed be the King that cometh in the Name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the Pharisees of the company said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, and said unto them, I tell you, that if these should hold their peace, the stones would cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was come near, he beheld the City, and wept for it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, O if thou hadst even known at the least in this thy day those things, which belong unto thy peace! but now are they hid from thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And shall make thee even with the ground, and thy children which are in thee, and they shall not leave in thee a stone upon a stone, because thou knewest not that season of thy visitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went also into the Temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying unto them, It is written, Mine house is the house of prayer, but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taught daily in the Temple. And the high Priests and the Scribes, and the chief of the people sought to destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they could not find what they might do to him: for all the people hanged upon him when they heard him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the people in the Temple, and preached the Gospel, the high Priests and the Scribes came upon him, with the Elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And spake unto him, saying, Tell us by what authority thou doest these things, or who is he that hath given thee this authority?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, and said unto them, I also will ask you one thing: tell me therefore:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they reasoned within themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven, he will say, Why then believed ye him not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we shall say, Of men, all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a Prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they answered, that they could not tell whence it was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you, by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable, A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen: and went into a strange country, for a great time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the time convenient he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen did beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent yet another servant: and they did beat him, and foul entreated him, and sent him away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover he sent the third, and him they wounded, and cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be that they will do reverence when they see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned with themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What shall the Lord of the vineyard therefore do unto them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will come and destroy these husbandmen, and will give out his vineyard to others. But when they heard it, they said, God forbid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he beheld them, and said, What meaneth this then that is written, The stone that the builders refused, that is made the head of the corner?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone, shall be broken: and on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high Priests, and the Scribes the same hour went about to lay hands on him (but they feared the people) for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they watched him, and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men to take him in his talk, and to deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest, and teachest right, neither dost thou accept any man’s person, but teachest the way of God truly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it lawful for us to give Caesar tribute or no?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show me a penny. Whose image and superscription hath it? They answered, and said, Caesars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Give then unto Caesar the things which are Caesar’s, and to God those which are God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they could not reprove his saying before the people: but they marveled at his answer, and held their peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees (which deny that there is any resurrection) and they asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man’s brother die having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brethren, and the first took a wife, and he died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the second took the wife, and he died childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the third took her: and so likewise the seven died, and left no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And last of all, the woman died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore at the resurrection, whose wife of them shall she be? for seven had her to wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said unto them, The children of this world marry wives, and are married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they which shall be counted worthy to enjoy that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry wives, neither are married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they can die no more, forasmuch as they are equal unto the Angels, and are the sons of God, since they are the children of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that the dead shall rise again, even Moses showed it besides the bush, when he said, The Lord is the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he is not the God of the dead, but of them which live: for all live unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of the Scribes answered, and said, Master, thou hast well said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after that, durst they not ask him anything at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he unto them, How say they that Christ is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David himself saith in the book of the Psalms, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Till I shall make thine enemies thy footstool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing David called him Lord, how is he then his son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware of the Scribes, which willingly go in long robes, and love salutations in the markets, and the highest seats in the assemblies, and the chief rooms at feasts:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which devour widow’s houses, and in show make long prayers: These shall receive greater damnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he beheld, he saw the rich men which cast their gifts into the treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saw also a certain poor widow which cast in thither two mites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all have of their superfluity cast into the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as some spake of the Temple, how it was garnished with goodly stones, and with consecrated things, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are these the things that ye look upon? the days will come wherein a stone shall not be left upon a stone, that shall not be thrown down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be? and what sign shall there be when these things shall come to pass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Take heed, that ye be not deceived: for many will come in my Name, saying, I am Christ, and the time draweth near: follow ye not them therefore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye hear of wars and seditions, be not afraid: for these things must first come, but the end followeth not by and by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and hunger, and pestilence, and fearful things, and great signs shall there be from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecute you, delivering you up to the assemblies, and into prisons, and bring you before Kings and rulers for my Name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall turn to you, for a testimonial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay it up therefore in your hearts, that ye cast not beforehand what ye shall answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will give you a mouth, and wisdom where against all your adversaries shall not be able to speak nor resist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, ye shall be betrayed also of your parents and of your brethren, and kinsmen, and friends, and some of you shall they put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my Name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet there shall not one hair of your heads perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By your patience possess your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye see Jerusalem besieged with soldiers, then understand that the desolation thereof is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let them which are in Judea, flee to the mountains: and let them which are in the midst thereof, depart out: and let not them that are in the country, enter therein:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these be the days of vengeance, to fulfill all things that are written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe be to them that be with child, and to them that give suck in those days: for there shall be great distress in this land, and wrath over this people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall fall on the edge of the sword, and shall be led captive into all nations, and Jerusalem shall be trodden under foot of the Gentiles, until the time of the Gentiles be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars, and upon the earth trouble among the nations, with perplexity: the sea and the waters shall roar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And men’s hearts shall fail them for fear and for looking after those things which shall come on the world: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then shall they see the Son of man come in a cloud, with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads: for your redemption draweth near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spake to them a parable, Behold, the fig tree, and all trees,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they now shoot forth, ye seeing them, know of your own selves, that summer is then near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise ye, when ye see these things come to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, This age shall not pass, till all these things be done:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be oppressed with surfeiting and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and lest that day come on you at unawares,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore, and pray continually, that ye may be counted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and that ye may stand before the son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the daytime he taught in the Temple, and at night he went out, and abode in the mount, that is called the mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people came in the morning to him, to hear him in the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew near, which is called the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high Priests and Scribes sought how they might kill him: for they feared the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then entered Satan into Judas, who was called Iscariot, and was of the number of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went his way, and communed with the high Priests and captains, how he might betray him to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were glad, and agreed to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he consented, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them, when the people were away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the Passover must be sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare us the Passover that we may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, Where wilt thou, that we prepare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Behold, when ye be entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water: follow him into the house that he entereth in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say unto the good man of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the lodging where I shall eat my Passover with my disciples?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he shall show you a great high chamber trimmed: there make it ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went, and found as he had said unto them, and made ready the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve Apostles with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you, before I suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, Henceforth I will not eat of it anymore, until it be fulfilleth in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, Take this, and divide it among you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God be come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took bread, and when he had given thanks, he brake it, and gave to them, saying, This is my body, which is given for you: do this in the remembrance of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise also after supper he took the cup, saying, This cup is that new Testament in my blood, which is shed for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me, is with me at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And truly the Son of man goeth as it is appointed: but woe be to that man by whom he is betrayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began to inquire among themselves which of them it should be, that should do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there arose also a strife among them, which of them should seem to be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles reign over them, and they that bear rule over them, are called bountiful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall not be so: but let the greatest among you be as the least: and the chiefest as he that serveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is greater, he that sitteth at table, or he that serveth? is not he that sitteth at table? And I am among you as he that serveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye are they which have continued with me in my tentations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That ye may eat, and drink at my table, in my kingdom, and sit on seats, and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desired you, to winnow you as wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: therefore when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto him: Lord, I am ready to go with thee into prison, and to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before thou hast thrice denied that thou knewest me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, When I sent you without bag, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye anything? And they said, Nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, But now he that hath a bag, let him take it, and likewise a scrip: and he that hath none, let him sell his coat, and buy a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say unto you, That yet the same which is written, must be performed in me, Even with the wicked was he numbered: for doubtless those things which are written of me, have an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said unto them, It is enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came out, and went (as he was wont) to the mount of Olives: and his disciples also followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the place, he said to them, Pray, lest ye enter into tentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was drawn aside from them about a stone’s cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Father, If thou wilt, take away this cup from me: nevertheless, not my will, but thine be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared an Angel unto him from heaven, comforting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But being in an agony, he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was like drops of blood, trickling down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he rose up from prayer, and came to his disciples, and found them sleeping for heaviness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into tentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
