verses.text: And while he yet spake, behold, a company, and he that was called Judas one of the twelve, went before them, and came near unto Jesus to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they which were about him, saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them smote a servant of the high Priest, and struck off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered, and said, Suffer them thus far: and he touched his ear, and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto the high Priests, and captains of the Temple, and the Elders which were come to him, Be ye come out as unto a thief with swords and staves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was daily with you in the Temple, ye stretched not forth the hands against me: but this is your very hour, and the power of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then took they him, and led him, and brought him to the high Priest’s house. And Peter followed afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter also sat down among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and having well looked on him, said, This man was also with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after a little while, another man saw him, and said, Thou art also of them. But Peter said, Man, I am not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the space of an hour after, a certain other affirmed, saying. Verily, even this man was with him: for he is also a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately while he yet spake, the cock crew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord turned back, and looked upon Peter: and Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men that held Jesus, mocked him, and struck him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had blindfolded him, they smote him on the face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy who it is that smote thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as it was day, the Elders of the people, and the high Priests and the Scribes came together, and led him into their Council,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, Art thou that Christ? tell us. And he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if also I ask you, you will not answer me, nor let me go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit at the right hand of the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said they all, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said to them, Ye say, that I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said they, What need we any further witness? for we ourselves have heard it of his own mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to accuse him, saying, We have found this man perverting the nation, and forbidding to pay tribute to Caesar, saying, That he is Christ a King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him, and said, Thou sayest it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Pilate to the high Priests, and to the people, I find no fault in this man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were the more fierce, saying, He moveth the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning at Galilee, even to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he knew that he was of Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, which was also at Jerusalem in those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long season, because he had heard many things of him, and trusteth to have seen some sign done by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then questioned he with him of many things: but he answered him nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high Priests also and Scribes stood forth and accused him vehemently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod with his men of war, despised him, and mocked him, and arrayed him in white, and sent him again to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were enemies one to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate called together the high Priests, and the rulers, and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverted the people: and behold, I have examined him before you, and have found no fault in this man, of those things whereof ye accuse him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him: and lo, nothing worthy of death is done of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will therefore chastise him, and let him loose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For of necessity he must have let one loose unto them at the feast.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the multitude cried at once, saying, Away with him, and deliver unto us Barabbas:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which for a certain insurrection made in the city, and murder, was cast in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate spake again to them, willing to let Jesus loose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they cried, saying, Crucify, crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them the third time, But what evil hath he done? I find no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let him loose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were instant with loud voices, and required that he might be crucified: and the voices of them and of the high Priests prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate gave sentence, that it should be as they required.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he let loose unto them him that for insurrection and murder was cast into prison, whom they desired, and delivered Jesus to do with him what they would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they led him away, they caught one Simon of Cyrene, coming out of the field, and on him they laid the cross, to bear it after Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there followed him a great multitude of people, and of women, which women bewailed and lamented him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus turned back unto them, and said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, the days will come, when men shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us: and to the hills, Cover us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if they do these things to a green tree, what shall be done to the dry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were two others, which were evildoers, led with him to be slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the evildoers: one at the right hand, and the other at the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them: for they know not what they do. And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people stood, and beheld: and the rulers mocked him with them, saying, He saved others: let him save himself, if he be that Christ the Chosen of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers also mocked him, and came and offered him vinegar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said, If thou be the King of the Jews, save thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a superscription was also written over him, in Greek letters, and in Latin, and in Hebrew, THIS IS THAT KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of the evildoers, which were hanged, railed on him, saying, If thou be that Christ, save thyself and us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other answered, and rebuked him, saying, Fearest thou not God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are indeed righteously here: for we receive things worthy of that we have done: but this man hath done nothing amiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me, when thou comest into thy kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, today shalt thou be with me in Paradise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was about the sixth hour: and there was a darkness over all the land, until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Sun was darkened, and the veil of the Temple rent through the midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and said, Father, into thine hands I commend my spirit. And when he thus had said, he gave up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Of a surety this man was just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done: smote their breasts, and returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all his acquaintances stood afar off, and the women that followed him from Galilee, beholding these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man named Joseph, which was a counselor, a good man and a just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not consent to the counsel and deed of them, which was of Arimathea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went unto Pilate, and asked the body of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid it in a tomb hewn out of a rock, wherein was never man yet laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that day was the preparation, and the Sabbath drew on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the women also that followed after, which came with him from Galilee, beheld the sepulcher, and how his body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they returned and prepared odors, and ointments, and resteth the Sabbath day according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first day of the week early in the morning, they came unto the sepulcher, and brought the odors which they had prepared, and certain women with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulcher,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And went in, but found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that as they were amazed thereat, behold, two men suddenly stood by them in shining vestures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were afraid, and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said to them, Why seek ye him that liveth, among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you, when he was yet in Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saying, that the Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they remembered his words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And returned from the sepulcher, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the remnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary the mother of James, and other women with them which told these things unto the Apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their words seemed unto them as a feigned thing, neither believed they them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then arose Peter and ran unto the sepulcher, and looked in and saw the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold two of them went that same day to a town which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs, called Emmaus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they talked together of all these things that were done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as they communed together, and reasoned, that Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their eyes were holden, that they could not know him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another as ye walk and are sad?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one (named Cleopas) answered and said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein in these days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, What things? And they said unto him, Of Jesus of Nazareth, which was a Prophet, mighty indeed and in word before God, and all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how the high Priests, and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we trusted that it had been he that should have delivered Israel, and as touching all these things, today is the third day, that they were done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, and certain women among us made us astonied, which came early unto the sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of Angels, which said, that he was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore certain of them which were with us, went to the sepulcher, and found it even so as the women had said, but him they saw not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, O fools and slow of heart to believe all that the Prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began at Moses, and at all the Prophets, and interpreted unto them in all the Scriptures the things which were written of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they drew near unto the town, which they went to, but he made as though he would have gone further.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us, for it is towards night, and the day is far spent. So he went in to tarry with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he sat at table with them, he took the bread, and blessed, and brake it, and gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their eyes were opened, and they knew him: and he was no more seen of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said between themselves, Did not our hearts burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and when he opened to us the Scriptures?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which said, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told what things were done in the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they spake these things, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and said unto them, Peace be to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were abashed and afraid, supposing that they had seen a spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and wherefore do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold mine hands and my feet: for it is I myself: handle me, and see: for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he showed them his hands and feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here any meat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took it, and did eat before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, These are the words, which I spake unto you while I was yet with you, that all must be fulfilled which are written of me in the Law of Moses, and in the Prophets, and in the Psalms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And said unto them, Thus is it written, and thus it behooved Christ to suffer, and to rise again from the dead the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that repentance, and remission of sins should be preached in his Name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now ye are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, I do send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward he lead them out into Bethany, and lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that as he blessed them, he departed from them, and was carried up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And were continually in the Temple, praising, and lauding God. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
